content:
StylusDevice Class

Definition

Represents a tablet pen used with a Tablet PC.

In this Article

public sealed class StylusDevice : System.Windows.Input.InputDevice
Inheritance
Object
DispatcherObject
InputDevice
StylusDevice

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
CheckAccess()
Dispatcher
VerifyAccess()

Examples

The following example demonstrates how to retrieve a reference to the default stylus device. 

' Get the current stylus device
Dim myStylusDevice As StylusDevice = Stylus.CurrentStylusDevice

// Get the current stylus device
StylusDevice myStylusDevice = Stylus.CurrentStylusDevice;

Properties

ActiveSource

Gets the PresentationSource that reports current input for the stylus.

public override System.Windows.PresentationSource ActiveSource { get; }
Value
PresentationSource

The PresentationSource that reports current input for the stylus.

Attributes
get: System.Security.SecurityCritical

Captured

Gets the element that captured the stylus.

public System.Windows.IInputElement Captured { get; }
Value
IInputElement

The IInputElement that captured the stylus.

DirectlyOver

Gets the IInputElement that the pointer is positioned over.

public System.Windows.IInputElement DirectlyOver { get; }
Value
IInputElement

The element the pointer is over.

Id

Gets the identifier for the stylus device.

public int Id { get; }
Value
Int32

The identifier for the stylus device.

InAir

Gets whether the tablet pen is positioned above, yet not in contact with, the digitizer.

public bool InAir { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the pen is positioned above, yet not in contact with, the digitizer; otherwise, false. The default is false.

InRange

Gets a value that indicates whether the tablet pen is in range of the digitizer.

public bool InRange { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the pen is within range of the digitizer; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Inverted

Gets a value that indicates whether the secondary tip of the stylus is in use.

public bool Inverted { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the secondary tip of the stylus is in use; otherwise, false. The default is false.

IsValid

Gets a value that indicates whether a stylus device is valid.

public bool IsValid { get; }
Value
Boolean

true to indicate a stylus is valid; otherwise false.

Name

Gets the name of the stylus.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of the stylus.

StylusButtons

Gets the stylus buttons on the stylus.

public System.Windows.Input.StylusButtonCollection StylusButtons { get; }
Value
StylusButtonCollection

A reference to a StylusButtonCollection object representing all of the buttons on the stylus.

TabletDevice

Gets the TabletDevice representing the digitizer associated with the current StylusDevice.

public System.Windows.Input.TabletDevice TabletDevice { get; }
Value
TabletDevice

The TabletDevice represents the digitizer associated with the current StylusDevice.

Target

Gets the element that receives input.

public override System.Windows.IInputElement Target { get; }
Value
IInputElement

The IInputElement object that receives input.

Methods

Capture(IInputElement)

Binds input from the stylus to the specified element.

public bool Capture (System.Windows.IInputElement element);
Parameters
element
IInputElement

The element to which the stylus is bound.

Returns
Boolean

true if the input element is captured successfully; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

element is null.

InvalidOperationException

element is neither UIElement or FrameworkContentElement.

Capture(IInputElement, CaptureMode)

Binds the stylus to the specified element.

public bool Capture (System.Windows.IInputElement element, System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode captureMode);
Parameters
element
IInputElement

The element to which the stylus is bound.

captureMode
CaptureMode

One of the CaptureMode values.

Returns
Boolean

true if the input element is captured successfully; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

element or captureMode is null.

InvalidOperationException

element is neither UIElement or FrameworkContentElement.

GetPosition(IInputElement)

Gets the position of the stylus.

public System.Windows.Point GetPosition (System.Windows.IInputElement relativeTo);
Parameters
relativeTo
IInputElement

The IInputElement to which the (x,y) coordinates are mapped.

Returns
Point

A Point that represents the position of the stylus, in relation to relativeTo.

Attributes
SecurityCriticalAttribute
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

relativeTo is neither UIElement or FrameworkContentElement.

GetStylusPoints(IInputElement)

Returns a StylusPointCollection that contains StylusPoint objects collected from the stylus.

public System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection GetStylusPoints (System.Windows.IInputElement relativeTo);
Parameters
relativeTo
IInputElement

The IInputElement to which the (x,y) coordinates in the StylusPointCollection are mapped.

Returns
StylusPointCollection

A StylusPointCollection that contains StylusPoint objects that the stylus collected.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

relativeTo is neither UIElement or FrameworkContentElement.

GetStylusPoints(IInputElement, StylusPointDescription)

Returns a StylusPointCollection that contains StylusPoint objects collected from the stylus. Uses the specified StylusPointDescription.

public System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection GetStylusPoints (System.Windows.IInputElement relativeTo, System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription subsetToReformatTo);
Parameters
relativeTo
IInputElement

The IInputElement to which the (x y) coordinates in the StylusPointCollection are mapped.

subsetToReformatTo
StylusPointDescription

The StylusPointDescription to be used by the StylusPointCollection.

Returns
StylusPointCollection

A StylusPointCollection that contains StylusPoint objects collected from the stylus.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

relativeTo is neither UIElement or FrameworkContentElement.

Remarks

subsetToReformatTo must be compatible with the Description property of the StylusPointCollection used by the GetStylusPoints(IInputElement) method. Use the GetCommonDescription method to get a StylusPointDescription before calling the GetStylusPoints method.

Synchronize()

Synchronizes the cursor and the user interface.

public void Synchronize ();
Attributes
SecurityCriticalAttribute

Remarks

Applications may need to locate the element that the cursor is positioned over. If the application uses animation, the DirectlyOver method might return an element that has moved out from under the cursor. Call Synchronize to be sure that DirectlyOver returns the proper element.

ToString()

Returns the name of the stylus device.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

The name of the StylusDevice.
